website_summaries.verdict: As long as you purchase the correct size, these thermal pants are sure to do a great job keeping you warm with their heavy duty cotton material.
pros: Whether worn on its own or as a base layer, this pair of thermal pants will keep the legs nice and toasty with its two-ply cotton construction
Rib-knit cuffs and chafe-free seams ensure a comfortable fit
cons: Sizing issues are a common complaint among many consumers
More specifically, these pants tend to run quite large

customer_reviews.title: size issue
customer_reviews.text: on the size chart on amazon page, it says for a small size it can fit 30"-32" waist however when I got the package, the box says something different for small it is actually 28"-30" waist. If I had known that, I would have ordered a medium size since it fits 32"-34" as it is shown in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Rakan Alotaibi

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: it's slightly larger. I'm 5 ft. 6,160lb. the blue one is M, the red one is S. the red fits better.
customer_reviews.author: L. Su

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff. I like 'em.
customer_reviews.text: Love 'em. These are more of a fleece-ish material than previous long johns i've had. Super comfortable. Sizing chart was accurate for me... which, I was skeptical about because I am a 6'2" guy with a 34 inch waist, so... I thought maybe it was a typo when it said I needed a Medium... but... spot on.
customer_reviews.author: The Railroad Bulls

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.text: I bought size large and the box shows L 36"-38". It also says warm, wicking, and 2-layer construction. 60% cotton and 40% polyester. Made in India. My waist is 38" but they are not too tight in the waistband. They are quite loose in the caboose so they could be worn over regular underwear. My only concern would be if they are long enough for people who have long legs. I am short and they fit me fine. I will be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: W. C. Burket

customer_reviews.title: Soft feel with a good waistband
customer_reviews.text: This product fits well and seems to be of high quality. It was sized as expected unlike some of the other makers that are far too small for the size they claim to be. Thus far, it has not stretched out of shape or suffered runs or tears. However, the material is 60% cotton and only 40% polyester. This is a thicker cloth than the high poly versions and it is warm but does not repel the wind and moisture as well as the thermals with much higher polyester content.
customer_reviews.author: KJP

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: The black color version of this item is inexplicably and inexcusably sized far too small.
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason, the black-colored version (specifically) of these thermal pants are easily a size (or more) smaller than the other offered colors for this item. That statement is not meant to diminish from the quality of the item itself, but to provide a buyer-beware notice that the sizing is ridiculously inaccurate (too too small!!!) for the black version. I typically buy the blue (navy) version (and will now always do so going forward), and the sizing is always consistent and as expected - and as such I rate the navy version with 5 stars. As for the black version... you're on your own with guessing the size that will fit you. Good luck with that.
customer_reviews.author: TheTruth

customer_reviews.title: Runs a touch large?
customer_reviews.text: My only comments are about sizing. I have a 31.5 waist. The sizing info on the amazon product page says waist for small is 30-32”. The box says small is 28-30”. They fit fine out of the box. Given the material blend I hope and expect them not to shrink. Size 40 suit jackets fit me perfectly, but I don’t know my measurements. Depending upon brand, sometimes small fits great and sometimes it is tight. For this product, for the top/chest, the info on the Amazon product page matches the box, medium is 38-40”. The shirt is a bit big and I probably would be happier in small (34-36”).
customer_reviews.author: elderlyguitarguy

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm in the 10's!
customer_reviews.text: I got a couple pairs of these for my vacation to SLC to spend Christmas with some family. It got down to the 10's while I was there and these kept me pretty warm! I played in the snow with my kid and went sledding with these and some jeans for a couple of hours and stayed warm. (I didn't want to buy snow pants since I wasn't going to Ski, snowboard, etc. ) They are super soft and comfortable too!
customer_reviews.author: Rev D.

customer_reviews.title: I Have A Problem With The Delivery
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem with my package delivery to my neighbor across the street. Instead of performing a SMS message to my phone, the delivery person gave MY package to the neighbor across the street. Had that neighbor kept my package I would have been out of receiving my order, plus money spent as a consequence. However, thank the heavens above, the neighbor was nice enough to present me with my ordered package. That said, the product itself was very good, that's why I am presenting this review with four stars! But it will be a long time before I make another order such as this again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sr

customer_reviews.title: Top & bottom colors are different, but quality is great
customer_reviews.text: These are incredibly soft! We haven’t tested them in the cold weather yet, but they seem thick and a good quality. The only disappointment I have are the color difference between the navy bottoms and the navy top. They’re not the same shade at all! The bottoms are more of a gray. Luckily they’re to wear under clothes, so it won’t really matter.
customer_reviews.author: K.Rich

customer_reviews.title: OK, But Made for a Man with a Giant Crotch
customer_reviews.text: These thermal pants are OK; they do the job. However, they are extremely large in the crotch area--meaning that the bottom of the crotch is at my knees. They feel weird when I first put them on and begin my day, but I get used to the extra length in the crotch area and they end up doing a fine job of keeping me warm.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Maddux

customer_reviews.title: HOW can a pair of thermals be thinner than pajama pants?
customer_reviews.text: So, got 'em today; tried 'em on and went for a 15 minute walk around the block, it was a tight fit. Came back, freezing cold. The weather today is 36-31*F with heavy rain & high winds. It's not even below freezing and I was chilled to the bone. These did not make my legs feel any warmer, the cold wind passed right through 'em. The fabric is thinner than my pajama pants. Even wearing my mesh gym shorts underneath my regular pants feels warmer than this "thermal". I bought it because of all the great reviews and recommendations, but quality doesn't come with cheap. Returning it right away and going back to Under Armour thermals.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm!
customer_reviews.text: I got these and the Heavy Weight double layer thermal shirt, which seem perfectly matched. Both were sized like I expected. Material is surprisingly warm for how lightweight it is. Does not make your outer layer seem small I found. They have been great keeping me warm in these 40 degree days, and if there is a downside, it is you won't want to take them off for bed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: They're Fine. Just Fine.
customer_reviews.text: These are obviously entry-level thermal wear. Materials are about average. Construction is average, leaning to the poor side. They generally do what they say, so three stars. However, fit is way off. "Large" typically indicates a waist of 36-38. These Large fit more like a 40, and they would seem to be ideal for someone 6'2". I am squarely in the "Large" camp for garments, but if I were to order these again, I would get a Medium. Also keep in mind, these offer no wind resistance at all (like I said, entry-level).
customer_reviews.author: William M. Workman

customer_reviews.title: If you like your waistband up around your ribs, these are the cut for you!
customer_reviews.text: The fit is nothing like pictured. If I pull the pants up so that their crotch meets my, um, crotch, the waistband comes 2 inches above my navel. The alternatives to get the waistband down to my hips would be: 1) Fold the waistband over twice, which isn't going to be comfortable under another layer of pants. 2) Pull the crotch down for a look like a gangsta who is unclear on the look. The crotch would then hang halfway to my knees. Terrible fit. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: M_and_A

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of the 60/40 cotton/ Polyester blend against my skin. As I was pricing my purchase I noted a number comments from buyers stating that the bottoms tended to run large. Heading that advice I purchased the bottoms in size medium and the tops in large. ( I am 5'11" 180 pounds) The tops fit fine.The bottoms although they fit well at the waist the legs are a tad short.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Redder

customer_reviews.title: Go with a smaller size than you would normally order
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 34 or 36 waist depending on the brand of pants. I ordered the medium size and the crotch was huge. It hung way too low. Much lower than my junk hangs. The legs were also baggier than expected. I ordered the small in addition to the medium and those were perfect. The crotch was exactly where it should be and the legs were much tighter. That way, you're able to wear them underneath pants much more comfortably. If you want this product to fit you like it does on the model in the pictures then order a size smaller than what the chart says. The length of the legs is perfect as well.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Fenis

customer_reviews.title: Great in the antarctic
customer_reviews.text: Took a cruise around South America with 4 days in the Antarctic. The entire lower part of Argentina and Chile - and, of course, the Antarctic- was frigid, windy and damp. Wore these under my khaki pants and water & wind proof outer pants and was as warm as a piece of toast. They were comfy, survived the ship's laundry and packed well. The price was great. I expect they have a lot more traveling in their future after the cruise ships resume their sailings.
customer_reviews.author: DocO

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're going to be walking outside a lot.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. You won't notice you're wearing them but you WILL feel warmer. 2 layers from jeans and then these thermals is just enough to get you through any climate. Just know if you buy them for a winter in London and Paris like I did, you might end up sweating. The weather can warm up on short notice and buildings always have their heat on full blast. Nevertheless these are great thermals that will save your lower half. Everyone says they're too short, but if you're wearing them I'm assuming you've got boots or something on so your ankles shouldn't be a concern.
customer_reviews.author: Samy

customer_reviews.title: Warm and smooth but too short.
customer_reviews.text: I like these. I had some old Fruit of the Loom, waffle-knit thermal leggings that kept my legs warm but after a fwe washings pulled the hair off my legs and thighs everytime I sat down or got up. These are smooth so they don't pull anything. I had to give them a 4 though because they are kind of short. I'm 6'0" and wear a 32-34" length in pants and these only go down to my mid calf after I sit down, compared the Fruit of the Loom that go down to my ankles. I cause an awkward drafty feeling unless I wear long socks pulled up. If' they'd been longer they'd be a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Somehow it felt like these actually wicked away heat
customer_reviews.text: I wore these in slightly windy 40 degree Fahrenheit weather. Somehow it felt like these actually wicked away heat. With any slight wind I could feel the material cooling, and on account of these being skin tight, it would cool me instead of keeping me warm. I actually feel warmer and more comfortable without these on. Even the "loose fit" version of this product that is rated for warmer temperatures seemed to keep me warmer than these. The fit was great (size:small, height: 5'2"), but if you're buying these to stay warm I would look elsewhere, despite the overwhelmingly positive reviews
customer_reviews.author: stbar

customer_reviews.title: Warm Base Layer
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. I don’t notice I’m wearing them all day. I’m a Florida boy that moved to Upstate SC so I wear these as soon as temps drop below 50. I usually wear them under my jeans and they keep me warm even in snowy weather. The “access hole” In the front is obviously a big plus as some other brands don’t have it. I’m 5’9” and 185 lbs 34” waist. I bought medium and they fit great. Just bought two more pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: They worked GREAT! The parts covered by he thermals stayed toasty ...
customer_reviews.text: My son and I participated as 'Redcoats' at a reenactment of the Boston Tea Party. It was in the single digits in Boston... coldest day of the year so far! Not able to wear winter gear as it would cover the red coat and breeches (think knee high shorts). Ordered these thermals to wear under the uniform. They worked GREAT! The parts covered by he thermals stayed toasty warm despite the biting cold. Sizing printed on the box seems correct. I'm 6' 2" and 220 lbs and ordered large despite always ordering XL. While I was on the upper end of the stated range, they fix as expected and worked better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these. Had to order some thermal underwear now ...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these. Had to order some thermal underwear now that my wife decided to get a German Shepard puppy with a lot of energy a month or two shy of winter (guess who takes her to the dog park every day?). Anyway, these are extremely comfortable and fit great. I gave it four stars instead of five simply because the elastic in the waistband leaves something to be desired...I'm constantly having to pull them up if I don't have my sweat pants or jeans on to hold them up.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Weird fit - waist too loose, legs too tight
customer_reviews.text: The fabric felt nice, and the pants were pleasantly warm. However, the fit was... strange and uncomfortable. I'm built like a beanpole, so I'm used to "waistband is loose and floppy", but that was paired with the legs being very snug, to the point where it was kind of distracting. Many folks with larger waists than me also have meatier legs; it seems like for them these would feel like compression stockings or something. I had no such troubles with their(though I did order a size up in that, and a loose fit is less of a problem with tops than pants).
customer_reviews.author: Anne Cross & Eric Reuss

customer_reviews.title: good base layer
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a base layer for when its cold for hiking, biking, or just walking outside. I used them for the first time yesterday, when the temperature was about 20 degrees and very windy. I only wore a pair of thin wind pants over these and was quite pleased. Sure I got cold after a while, I was only wearing a base layer and the equivalent of a windbreaker over my thighs on a very windy day, but without the base layer I wouldn't have made it out the door, let alone walked for a good hour.
customer_reviews.author: Review Chick

customer_reviews.title: Way too short
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand of thermals. First time I have purchased new ones in years. The bottoms are unusually short. In the size large they are probably 36 waist and 28 length. I own 10 pairs of thermals and these are 4-6 inches shorter than all the others. They are soft, warm, nice quality. If you are short, these are for you. If you're tall, look elsewhere. I should have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: BigJerm

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. My husband works construction and he's pretty hard on his clothes including thermals. I've made the mistake of buying cheaper thermals and some didn't make it through one wash without looking extremely worn.These have held up for two winters so far,with no little nubbies or fuzz balls on them and they get washed frequently.The seams were nicely made and are soft against the skin. I will be ordering more eventually only to replace other brands that I've purchased. It may sound silly to go on about a pair of thermals but with a large family stretching dollars doesn't always mean making the cheapest purchase available.Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Miriah Swisher

customer_reviews.title: loses it's elasticity
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2016 in the trash 2019, the waist loses it's elasticity and stretches out to a comical size. Maybe they improved the waistband quality, but it's not worth it to take the risk again.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the size description.
customer_reviews.text: Wore the thermal bottoms during the cold weather and they kept me warm. Only disappointment was the size box on Amazon's web sit did not match with the sizing on the box the product came it. The bottom is more snug than I like. The medium description on Amazon should have fit, but when I received and tried on, they were small. I look at box and their medium size was smaller than the medium size on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: C. A.

customer_reviews.title: With Overall Population getting taller, Why don't these come in LONG any more?
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the material is great and is 5 star. The fit of the upper is great and is 5 star. I gave them 2 stars to get the attention of the manufacturer because they need to go back to manufacturing these in a LONG for those with longer than average legs. I have these same Duofold thermals in a LONG size from 20+ years ago and they fit just right. But they are worn out and now irreplaceable .... grrrr.
customer_reviews.author: BigBlock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent thermals and comfort
customer_reviews.text: These have been invaluable in getting me through winter on the east coast. The material is comfortable and snug everywhere I want it to be while offering plenty of swinging freedom in the crotch. I wear these two days on and after 4-5 months the elastic waist on some of them is going bad, but not fall-off-your-butt bad. Next winter I will probably buy enough of these so that I can wear them just one day on and hopefully that will add to the longevity. Either way, the comfort and fit is too good for me to risk deviating to any other brand of long underwear right now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Well Constructed And Very Warm - Sizes Run "Generous"
customer_reviews.text: No need to "oversize with these. I'm 5'7", 40" waist. I ordered XL first, and then (2) more Large, which fit better. I prefer a little extra room for wearing under coveralls, but someone who prefers a snug fit might like one size smaller. Very breathable. Would rate these as "mid-weight". All are very comfortable and well-sewn.
customer_reviews.author: maintenance guy

customer_reviews.title: Good When Snowing
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear 32x30 pants, but for undergarments my waist lands between 30-31 depending on the brand. I went with a small size and they fit perfectly on the legs and the length. However, I just felt they were too loose on the groin area, but other than that they are definitely warm. I got three pairs and used them in Colorado while it snowed. I think the weather was btwn 0 and -6 degrees at night and I was happily warm.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzman1868

customer_reviews.title: This thing keeps me warm and its comfy
customer_reviews.text: This thing keeps me warm and its comfy. 5' 6'' 145pds slim/athletic build and bought the medium. Cuts right before the ankles and sometimes rides up my legs so I'll pull it down during the day. Nothing terrible I do that maybe 2-3 times a day. I'm gaining weight so all my pants are fitting smaller these days and I usually like a loose fit but these get in there right under the radar.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Good fitting, soft, long underwear or better yet, everyday around the house pants!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves to wear what is considered " long underwear" as sleeping pajamas. I bought him a pair 2 years ago to wear under pants when its really cold out, but he thought they were so comfortable that he began living in them round the clock while at home.(he's retired). When I saw these I was looking for a softer material than what he already had and these fit the bill nicely! I got a pair in Navy and one in Blk and he's been wearing them everyday(makes me wish I hadn't found them in the first place!"). They wash up well, haven't shrunk or stretched out or lost color. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Walters

customer_reviews.title: Bad sizing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beware the sizing on the site is incorrect. Sizing on the site says a large fits a 38-40 waist. When I looked at the box these came in it says 36-38. These are extremely tight in the legs so I have to pull really hard on them to get them up around my waist. Also I like how Amazon lists the original price at $40 when a 19.99 price is on the box. Anyways I'll be returning these. Not sure if I want a bigger size or a different style. These are an odd fit as stated in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Solidsnake081180

customer_reviews.title: A Comfortable Counter to Icy Days
customer_reviews.text: My selection of the "Somewhat large" characterization isn't meant to be a criticism of the product. I am a rather small boned person. In addition, I have been deliberately loosing weight. Although the garment felt loose on first wearing, a first session in a clothes washer and then a dryer shrunk it to a more exact fit. The material doesn't have the pebbly weave other long johns I wear in winter have. This is a plus since the texture of those others tend to cause areas of itching. I would buy this garment again.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Shephard

customer_reviews.title: I needed these so bad and they're great!
customer_reviews.text: These are soo warm and cozy. Much better than Underarmor, they keep you warm and fit really true to size. I work outside a lot for my job and I wish I had bought these sooner. they are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Preston Pettit

customer_reviews.title: Good for one winter...
customer_reviews.text: Loved these when I got them. Worked an outdoor job all winter in northern Michigan with temps from 20 below to 32 degrees Fahrenheit. This year, which is the second or third year I’ve had them, I’ve noticed all the elasticity in the waistband is gone! These things literally will not stay on my waist, basically garbage. Still no holes or tears in material which is nice but not sure why the waistband would go to sh*t...
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves them. He has been wearing them outside with temps in the 20's and says they are comfortable and warm. Fit as expected for a 5' 11" man, I bought medium size pants. He's only had them for a week, so I don't know about durability, but since he likes them so much he is wearing them constantly, they will definitely be tested.
customer_reviews.author: DPal

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm. Central Mass owned
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'3" and size 31 waist and mediums fit perfect. These are awesome. I work in MA in the elements and was worried that the single layer wouldn't be hot enough, but they're definitely holding up and keeping me warm outside. The other day it was -1 at 6 am and it was still cold on my legs but not cold to the point of being miserable. It kept me from having to worry about my legs atleast because everything is cold in that weather like hands and feet. But warm legs and chest and it's a good day.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect base layer for any outdoor winter activity
customer_reviews.text: Got these for recent trip the Iceland, and was very impressed. They are not so tight they feel restricting, but are snug, flexible, and very warm. Wore them under hiking pants, and didn't feel cold at all, even with temps dipping below 20 degrees, and lots of wind. Definitely good quality for the price. These would be prefect for any cold weather outdoor activity.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfortable during cold snaps
customer_reviews.text: I live in a mostly warmer climate that occasionally gets lows in the 20s, and my office tends to be on the cooler side during the winter months. These are just the right thickness and offer just the right amount of warmth to keep my legs comfortable in the winter. The material is very soft and flexible but also holds up well. As far as the fit, trust the size guide here! My waist size is 35-36 inches and the guide here says that's a Medium. The box, however, says Medium is for 32-34 inches. However they fit me just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality elastic waistband...
customer_reviews.text: These were great until the waistband stretched out. My husband is a fit athletic guy with a small waistline and somehow the waist band stretched out HUGE and did not revert back at all. The elastic became completely useless, and these were not worn much. Can not recommend due to poor quality...
customer_reviews.author: Saver I.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality & price
customer_reviews.text: I bought 1 set of these single ply thermal underwear pants to check them out. I found the quality to be terrific and the price was about 1/3 that of the 2-ply Duofold underwear pants. After trying them out, I bought 3 more sets. I have not tried them in cold weather yet but I feel confident that they will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cushing

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, very warm, "non-intrusive".
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfectly, and add a nice additional layer of warmth. I like to wear very slim jeans/joggers, and was worried these would feel bulky, but you barely notice them there. They seemed a little thin at first, but don't let that fool you, they add a lot of warmth. I also never felt overly warm or sweaty. Overall, super happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Fits Well
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit snug on the calves and the crotch region has ample space, as others have mentioned. Still comfortable though. Lowest temp I've been outdoors with these is mid 20s F, and they work great, even with a bit of wind chill. I wear them under my dress pants and they don't get overly warm when I go indoors. I've worn them for entire days at the office without any discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Fits like an insulating second skin.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple pairs of these because I work in a very cold office, and it's coldest near the floor, so I have to layer up my feet and lower extremities if I want to be comfortable during the cold months. I work weekends, and it seems even colder with just me and the skeleton crew in the building. These are extremely comfortable and have kept their shape for the few months that I've owned them, with no signs of defect or failure, so far. I will probably buy more, since these are working so well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michelangelo Flores

customer_reviews.title: I thought there was some sort of thermal light fleece ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought there was some sort of thermal light fleece inside. There is a brand called climate right which is what I wanted for my boyfriend but they only make women's thermal clothing. We went to Prague in Europe and these were not even used. 30 degree weather would definitely not be enough, need some sort of wool/fleece! Had to use a pair from Target every day for 5 days instead.
customer_reviews.author: missiefae

customer_reviews.title: Getting what you pay for :(
customer_reviews.text: I've been experimenting with different thermal underwear brands, made of different materials. I think the reason why it's so highly rated is because it's so cheap. But you are getting what you paid for. It's short so can't tuck it in my socks also my junk was sweating in it. Was concerned about smell. It's a one day underwear. I'd rather spend a few more $$ and get merino wool or even cotton.
customer_reviews.author: Tanweer Majid

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm
customer_reviews.text: Nice and warm. They need to have an option for longer size. I am 6'3 tall. They fit but could be a little longer for me. Anyone under 6 feet tall, fit should be good. Don't wash in hot or dry on hot, BECAUSE they will shrink. I bought some duofold shirts and they shrank a bit. Short in the arms for me also, but i have a long wing span. Overall very warm and light weight, even under your shirt or pants. I ware them with just a tee shirt under them. My wife begs me to wash them soon. I ware them every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits just like the picture
customer_reviews.text: Got these in a Medium. I normally am a 32x32, so these come just to the bottom of my ankles. It fits exactly as the picture shows them on the model so I guess this is correct. I may go with a large next time as these are somewhat tight (I guess they're maybe supposed to be though). Just be aware for ordered. Material is nice and soft. Feels like an expensive T shirt in a merino feel so at first I didn't think they'd be warm. However, just trying them on inside I could feel the warmth immediately. Maybe won't keep you completely insulated at super cold temps, but will help. Comfortable material and fit.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B.

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Soft, Light Weight, Well-Built and a Good Fit
customer_reviews.text: These two-layer thermal bottoms are easily as warm as many mid-weight Capilene items sold for 3 x the price. They do not dry as quickly as Capilene, but are well-made, and will definitely see you through more than one winter. Great as a base layer for cold weather, or as sleep or lounge wear. While they are made in Asia - mine were marked 'made in India' - the sizing tags are consistent with garments made in the US, so no need to order a size up. Definitely a cut above the old waffle fabric thermals. PS: What the manufacturer calls 'Navy' is really dark grey with a hint of blue.
customer_reviews.author: Sven Galileo

customer_reviews.title: Fit is short and loose
customer_reviews.text: I wanted some lightweight long underwear for work, in a large warehouse that gets fairly cold in the winter. I have been looking for something soft and comfortable. I'm 5'10" 165lbs, i ordered the medium. The legs don't reach my ankles and the crotch droops down to about mid thigh. not sure the body type they measured to make these, but they don't fit all that great. I was looking for something more form fitting. the material is soft and the waistband is comfortable, so i would feel right only giving 2 stars, but the fit is not so good.
customer_reviews.author: cmj4979

customer_reviews.title: Good at first but will stretch out
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to product a year or two ago. The thermals worked great and fit great when I first purchased then. I was looking for a comperable brand to under armor because the other thermals I had were getting older. Now my under armor stayed tight fitting these however did not. These have streted out too much and way too lose when I wear them. They are nice at first but over time get too worn out too fast.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P

customer_reviews.title: Horrible fit. Unless you have an enormous crotch (lucky you)
customer_reviews.text: Like many others stated, the fit is ridiculous. I am 6'0" tall with a 36-38 waist, and ordered the Large. There is way too much room in the crotch/butt area- so much so I could lift the waist band and cover my entire gut. I spared you guys a picture of that, but trust the reviews that knock it for it's sizing. I wound up paying more for a Carhartt underpant- but the quality and fit was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Casian

customer_reviews.title: Really nice.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize cotton is a big no-no when it comes to winter cycling and winter exercise in general. That's my fault. I still love these though. I walk/bike 3.5 miles to work and back 5 nights a week and that make a huge difference. I can wear just these and some jeans over them with a pair of thermal socks in 40-45 degree weather and my lower body will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: kanuhobrewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm and they fit nicely
customer_reviews.text: They fit really well, not too tight but also not too loose, its basically fitting onto your legs, which I liked, because it offers warmth but is also comfortable. I get cold easily so I wear these in the house, under my sweatpants, and I haven't been cold ever since trying them. They seem like a good product for this price, I'd recommend everyone to try them out.
customer_reviews.author: Mass

customer_reviews.title: doesn't seem like it will last over 1-2 months)
customer_reviews.text: Size issues. The pants says that they are meant for waist 28-30, however, that is not the case. I am a 29 (across multiple brands) but this particular small size was too big. I would say it would be loose even on a 31. Will likely need to throw it away as soon as the flimsy elastic band gives up (prediction: doesn't seem like it will last over 1-2 months). Also, this was my first online purchase of clothes. Didn't work out.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for 33 below
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these because the forecast was for 30 below. We got 33 below and lots of wind. The fit was perfect for me and there wasn't extra material bunching up under my pants, so that was nice. As for keeping my legs warm, they did a good job and I didn't even notice it being that cold, so I can say I am glad I purchased them. I will not make any comments about durability because I hope to god I don't need to wear them more than once or twice a year.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sohm

customer_reviews.title: Good for mountian climbing and cold weather camping
customer_reviews.text: I wore these (and the matching shirt) to sleep in while camping in the Rockies at 9600 ft elevation in mid Sept. Roughly 28 at night. Also wore them to hike a 14er, starting out at 4:30 AM. Very warm and comfy. They wick sweat super well. During the long 8 hour climb, it was cold at times and warm depending on the sun / shade and wind. I actually sweat a lot on my back where my backpack rides. Then I would pop up on a mountain ridge into the bitter wind. These performed better than I could have expected. I plan to wear them during hunting season as well.
customer_reviews.author: deck4896

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boyfriend, as he's moving to a colder climate. We wore them out for a chilly single-digit date, and he stayed nice and warm, and they were very comfortable. I asked for his review and he said they fit well (he wears medium in most things, and I ordered medium in this), and he would give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: What I expected and got!
customer_reviews.text: The fit was excellent. Ordered Medium. I'm 5'10.5" and 150 lbs. I did not expect great warmth, given the price and reviews. they were right. Modestly warm but I have had much better in the past. Nobody makes Arctic Fleece anymore and the warmer types are double the price. So I got want I expected and I am satisfied with it. I might buy another pair or two eventually. As long as you truly know what your getting, you can make a good decision, right?
customer_reviews.author: Scott H. Irving

customer_reviews.title: size is off
customer_reviews.text: these are awesome but buy a size smaller, I am 5'11" and 185 lbs and the medium (M) fits great - I would usually buy L or Xl
customer_reviews.author: Drago V

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermal Pant
customer_reviews.text: Husband works outside year round and said the Duofold thermals were the softest he has owned. Liked them very much. Bought a size larger than he normally wears to account for any shrinkage with washing and drying. Fit him perfectly and he wore them yesterday when temp was 9 in the morning and reached a high of only 30. He wants more of them.
customer_reviews.author: B W Parker

customer_reviews.title: The fit was good. I rode my motorcycle with these on in ...
customer_reviews.text: The fit was good. I rode my motorcycle with these on in temps just above 40 degrees. Rode on the interstate at 70 to 75 MPH. My legs were kept fairly warm with just a pair of jeans over them. They were also good, for me anyways, at temps below freezing. I think I would buy something heavier next time for extended exposure. Like I said they have kept my legs warm. And Yes I would recommend to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: The best set of long johns I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The best set of long johns I've ever owned. They are very soft and comfortable. I've washed them at least 5 times and there is no shrinking. I wash and dry them along with my regular laundry. Perfect for the Mid-Atlantic climate. Warm enough to be worn outside in 20-degree weather and 20 mile an hour wind. I'm also very comfortable wearing mine in the house because I keep the house cool.
customer_reviews.author: js

customer_reviews.title: Holy Moly! They’re warm.
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Central Valley of California. Temperatures here during the winter reach 25 degrees Fahrenheit. I work in a warehouse but I’m often outside. I bought 1 pair to see if they’d be worth the price difference over the packs of 3 you get from Fruit of the loom for 6 dollars. These are much more comfortable, not itchy at all, and are much much warmer than the others. I bought 2 more for the real cold nights.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: As promised
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable material (assume it's cotton), and really helps keeping you warm in the winter. I walk to the train station in Chicago and from the train to work, so slacks really get chilly. These really help, and they aren't so bulky that they show under my clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Shanemeister

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite thermals!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy and soft. Does well at helping to hold in warmth. I also own several pairs of thermal shirts by this same company and absolutely love them. I've washed these in cold water many times and they have not lost any of the comfort nor have they shrank. Will purchase again if I need more!
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: ... runs extremely large and falls down the length was perfect before first wash they shrink about 3 inches to ...
customer_reviews.text: The waist is completely off for sizing runs extremely large and falls down the length was perfect before first wash they shrink about 3 inches to small after wash sat at ankles when purchased after wash came up about 3 inches above ankles not recommended already requested a return on product
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: The BEST damn long johns I've ever owned! PERIOD! Extremely Comfortable!, nice fit!, very nice feel to it, no annoying tags, no stinging stitches!, absolutely DREAM thermals! lol. Keeps me warm in the frigid temperature! for people trying to size this right; I got the [Mid-Weight - Large size Ankle Length Pant] (that's what it says on the box) My waist is 40, chest 44 height 5'3" weight 173 lbs. Build quality seems strong, though my review is only after one use so far, so can't tell how good it'll hold in the long run. Note; Originally I thought there were 3 in a pack, but that was wishful thinking. Only one in a pack, but absolutely worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: nz

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this particular brand of thermal underwear for years. It fits really well, isn't bulky and does an excellent job of insulating from both the cold and heat. I work in industry and stood outside in below zero conditions and inside next to a glass making furnace. These work like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cerqua

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a very reasonable cost!
customer_reviews.text: As I ordered them, I must admit I was a bit skeptical, but after several opportunities to wear them while walking in zero and near zero temperatures I've become very pleased with them. Their wicking really helps keep the temperature around the skin quite constant, and they feel really comfortable. As noted in someone else's review, they don't fit as snugly as briefs, so unless you're more of a boxers fan don't be surprised if you're more comfortable with a pair of briefs as an under layer (I am). I'd recommend giving them a try.
customer_reviews.author: conure clan

customer_reviews.title: Too small, so returning, but good quality
customer_reviews.text: I liked it, except the size (S) was a bit too short and tight around my ankles, riding high. I am a 6ft tall man with a small/thin frame (weigh aprox 140lb) and I 30inch waist, but the leg length was a bit to too short and the legs were a bit too tight. Also, the inseam was way too long for how short and tight these thermal pants were. I will be returning this along with the matching shirt (S) which had the same issue, though they are of decent quality.
customer_reviews.author: JON G.

customer_reviews.title: Overall really satisfied with these.
customer_reviews.text: Theses are very comfortable actually. I use them as thermals for when i ride, but after a cetain point of coldness, they dont really hold up anymore. I ride in the north east where its regularly been in the teens. But overall, Im happy with these and I use them a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Mega-moto-lomaniac

customer_reviews.title: FITS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: THIS RUN LARGE BUT HERE IT IS MY HUSBAND WEIGHTS 170 AND HIS HEIGHT IS 5'7 AND THE SMALL SIZE FITS GREAT . ALL THE OTHER REVIEWS HELPED ME WITH PICKING THE RIGHT SIZE FOR MY HUSBAND. SMALL WILL FIT EASILY TO SOMEONE WHO WEIGHTS 200 I THINK. VERY GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Warmth and Comfort, in pants
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I primarily wear them under my jeans for warmth and comfort throughout a cold day. They keep me warm, they keep me comfortable, and there's nothing better than that. I wore them while shoveling after this recent snowstorm and they kept me warm the entire time (perhaps a little too warm). =) The legs connect a little sooner than most pants, which can cause them to bunch up if you're wearing tighter-fitting pants (I do not). Other than that I foresee no issues with these and will continue to wear them happily.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not great!
customer_reviews.text: These are just OK. If you have never had really good sucks then you might be satisfied. If you have ever had a pair of "Smart Wool" or similar then you will Quickly see and feel the difference. These are like a big pair of loose fitting sweat pants as opposed to a very good fitting pair of jeans is the best way I can describe it. For the price they seem warm enough. I've only worn a couple of times. I will update the review later.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gregory

customer_reviews.title: good but short
customer_reviews.text: these are good quality but unless you are shorter than 5-6 you will probably find these too short. looks like they value engineered every bit of cloth they could. with 34" inseam these come 5 inches above the ankles, and the waist feels a bit low too. nothing like having your thermals gap open in the back when you bend or stoop
customer_reviews.author: livingthedream

customer_reviews.title: Form fitting.  True long under wear as opposed to some sort of baggy layer between skin and pants.
customer_reviews.text: Very form fitting. 6'4" 225#. Large was the ticket for me. The opposite of a loose fit. Works well with flannel lined jeans when outdoors in 40 degree weather. I recommend washing in cold water and line drying to keep from shrinking.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy James

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Thermals
customer_reviews.text: My husband love these thermals. He said the material is soft and doesn't make him like the other ones he had to used to break his skin out. This is my second round of ordering these same thermals. He still had the other pair I order he just needed more to keep changing up. These are easily 5 stars and hubby approved!
customer_reviews.author: YhwhKhai

customer_reviews.title: The inside temperatures have ranged from the teens to the thirties for the several weeks he wore these at work and LOVED them. T
customer_reviews.text: My husband works in a warehouse that has no heat or AC. He is working at night during the coldest parts of the day with the truck docks wide open. The inside temperatures have ranged from the teens to the thirties for the several weeks he wore these at work and LOVED them. They kept his legs warm and no complaints at all. He isn't freezing at night at work now, unlike some of his fellow co-workers.
customer_reviews.author: Abegail

customer_reviews.title: Best winter investment yet
customer_reviews.text: Best winter investment yet! These are very nice, super comfy, and they fit perfectly. Not too loose, and not so tight that your voice changes a few octaves. I gambled and bought 10 pair, and it definitely paid off!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy H

customer_reviews.title: Good moderate warming
customer_reviews.text: going to buy these again... these are great for moderate warming, and doesnt give me trouble putting on a pair of jeans.. id say its good down to 40 degrees, then colder you will start to feel the coldness creeping in. mind you, we all handle the cold differently, but these seem durable - havent fallen apart in the wash yet.
customer_reviews.author: Girald

customer_reviews.title: Another rubbish garment
customer_reviews.text: You buy a garment then you find two holes in it. What a shame really. It’s a soft material with moderate thickness. I wanted to like it. But without having two holes One was out of the box and the second after the first wash
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed  El Morr

customer_reviews.title: Saved my butt (literally)
customer_reviews.text: I am 6' tall and about 160 lbs and the medium fit me well. Large would probably be too big. I commute into a city and spend a good amount of time waiting for trains, walking outside, and even biking partway to work. These were the perfect thickness to take the chill off in the cold northeast mornings without being too hot throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: Jon K

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Base Layer!
customer_reviews.text: I slept in a two man tent in my zero degree mummy bag with just these and a matching thermal top and I was toasty. It was twenty degrees outside for all 9 hours I was hunkered in my bag and I was not upset wearing this. Got up and made breakfast kept this base layer on until the sun came up and baked me right out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Bush

customer_reviews.title: These were great during the winter to add another layer and keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 32" waist and a 30" inseam and the medium size fit me perfectly. These were great during the winter to add another layer and keep warm. I definitely recommend wearing another layer under these to stay comfortable though. They aren't very comfortable on their own. The waistband is comfortable and the tag is printed on. It also has elastic at the bottom of the legs to keep everything from riding up throughout the day. These stay comfortable throughout the day, keep you warm, and are great quality. Would definitely buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Has its pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Great size and material, but if you find yourself working in New York City during the winter, outside, in the middle of the night, at the airport, welllll you may need a couple of these, because these long johns alone will definitly not keep you warm. But that's if you find yourself in that certain situation. Other than that they fit really well and are super comfortable, especially for lounging around in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Emir

customer_reviews.title: Amazon size chart innacurate!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband...first of all....Amazon, your size chart is way off in comparison to the chart on the box of the product. Second...He seemed pleased with the pants other than that they were a size or two, too big. They are definetly thicker than his usual go to 32° HEAT brand (we get them from Costco usually). And they have a tapered or cuffed bottom at the ankle, like a jogger. If it Amazon didn't charge for return shipping for exchanges we'd send them back for a smaller size but they do, so here we are.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality !
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality pants but pants ran small, the top runs true to size. My husband is 5'9 about 170 lbs and typically we order the large but the length was shorter than expected. Placed another order for XL and the pants fit a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: CGrn

customer_reviews.title: 2nd purchase of great product
customer_reviews.text: These are actually my 2nd purchase of 2 in a box. I am 5'10" and weigh about 175. I found that the large were too low in the crotch and the waist was a little big. The mediums allow enough "junk" room and leave the bottoms of the legs up just a bit to leave room for thick over-socks, boots, etc. The comfort and workablility couldn't be sweeter.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and soft thermal pants.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these thermal pants and I am planning on buying another pair soon. I have purchased other thermal pants from local stores and none compare to the quality of these. I ordered the XL size and they are very comfortable. Since I am 5'3 there is extra room in length however because of the stretch material they have just the right amount of give. The waistband is pleasant and does not crease or curl over. The pants are well made, soft, and had no noticeable shrinkage or fading after multiple washes. I would recommend this product to wear by themselves or under clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Toasty Enough for Alaska
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son-in-law last Christmas and he loves them. They keep him warm in the winter which is excellent, since he is a mail carrier in the interior of Alaska. He likes them enough that he's requested more this Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Exposure

customer_reviews.title: Very weird fitting.
customer_reviews.text: The cut is very strange. I am 5'8 and I wear size 29 pants. The legs on these are way too short and the whole butt, crotch area is twice as roomy as it needs to be. It looks like you're wearing grandmas underwear.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Husband likes them
customer_reviews.text: Husband seems to like them and had me order more! He’s 5’11” and about 200lbs and I ordered a large. I had ordered one for him to try and he had me order 2 more! He wears these daily in the winter to work and they seem to stay up and keep him warm.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W.

customer_reviews.title: Warm enough; decent fit
customer_reviews.text: I have a 31-inch waist and a 34-inch inseam. Warned by other reviews that they run large, I got the Small size, and I'm glad I did. They are still a little loose in the crotch area, but not a lot; they fit well under jeans while I was walking around Switzerland in February for two weeks (which was the purpose of the purchase). I got two so that one could be worn while the other was being washed. I'd say these were well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: William L Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Toasty warm
customer_reviews.text: These are my third pair, and I recommend these for the medium under layer. I live where the temperature is in the teens and 20's as a high. You won't be sorry, I'll be warm!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike O.

product_meta.title: Duofold Men's Mid-Weight Wicking Thermal Pant
product_meta.description: Classic 2-ply cotton-rich thermal underwear. Choose these base-layer bottoms for everyday warmth during low activity levels. Soft texture-rich knit traps air between two thermal layers. Result: a chill-blocking barrier that keeps you comfortably warm. Tag-free elastic waist wicks moisture for added comfort. Ankle length with chill-blocking rib-knit cuffs and non-chafe flat-locked seams. Close-to-body fit with convenient front fly.
feature_bullets: Choose these base-layer bottoms for everyday warmth during low activity levels
C Vapor technology wicks sweat away from skin for drier, cooler comfort
